definition: to pan for gold/to try to make a fortune
to wash/to clean out/to cleanse/to eliminate/to dredge
gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: They had been working the stream for 10 days, but it hadn't panned out.
sentences.chinese: 他们连续10天在这条小溪里淘金，但还没淘出金子。

sentences.english: Separating the gold from the dirt was done in a washing cradle.
sentences.chinese: 将金子和沙子分开是用淘金槽完成的。

sentences.english: There's a green gold rush on Capitol Hill.
sentences.chinese: 在国会山正在发生着一个绿色淘金热。

sentences.english: Then the gold seekers had to move their supplies up the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 随后，这些淘金者还必须将他们的补给运过大山。

sentences.english: Private entrepreneurships were introduced and many countryside villagers were moving to the cities to earn money.
sentences.chinese: 私营企业被引入，许多农村居民涌向城市去淘金。

sentences.english: In nearby areas, gold mining has released mercury into the air and water.
sentences.chinese: 而在附近的地方，淘金者们向空气和水源还排放水银。

sentences.english: Many people poured into South Africa for gold rush in the 19C.
sentences.chinese: 19世纪有大批的人涌入南非去淘金。

sentences.english: In 1858 Frey after the river gold rush rapid development.
sentences.chinese: 1858年弗雷赛河淘金热后迅速发展。

sentences.english: In the golden rush of 49, he succeeded in driving stake in a large piece of land.
sentences.chinese: 在49淘金潮中，他在一大片土地上立了界桩。

sentences.english: When I was young, I went looking for gold in California. I never found enough to make me rich.
sentences.chinese: 我年轻时候曾去加州淘金，这并没有使我富裕。

sentences.english: People came out here to try and reinvent themselves  with the Gold Rush even.
sentences.chinese: 淘金热的时候，人们来到这里试着开始新的生活。

sentences.english: You can be sure that the players of Juventus who will leave Turin will end up flying to England.
sentences.chinese: 这些尤文球星不出意料地话将会去英伦淘金。

sentences.english: Many enterprises of Shanghai go on a 'gold-rush' spree in the western parts of China.
sentences.chinese: 很多上海企业涌向西部，掀起了去西部之淘金热。

sentences.english: Many enterprises of Shanghai go on a "gold-rush" spree in the western parts of China.
sentences.chinese: 很多上海企业一起涌向西部，掀起了去西部的淘金热。

sentences.english: Some old miners are still panning for gold in the streams.
sentences.chinese: 一些老矿工仍旧在这些河里淘金。

definition: to trade/to carry out commercial activities/in business
hot money, money flowing from one currency to another in the hope of quick profit
the first pot of gold/the initial profits from an economic endeavour
to go out to sea/to enter the sea (to swim etc)/(fig.) to take the plunge (e.g. leave a secure job, or enter prostitution etc)
Africa/abbr. for 阿非利加洲[A1 fei1 li4 jia1 Zhou1]
to lay down a family fortune/to get rich/to become prosperous
